navigators.smart.tom.core
Class TOMLayer

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      navigators.smart.tom.core.TOMLayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, RequestReceiver
public final class TOMLayer
extends java.lang.Thread
implements RequestReceiver

This class implements a thread that uses the PaW algorithm to provide the application a layer of total ordered messages

                LeaderModule lm,
                Acceptor a,

Creates a new instance of TOMulticastLayer

Parameters:
manager - Execution manager
receiver - Object that receives requests from clients
lm - Leader module
a - Acceptor role of the PaW algorithm
cs - Communication system between replicas
conf - TOM configuration

requestReceived

public void requestReceived(TOMMessage msg)
This method is invoked by the comunication system to deliver a request. It assumes that the communication system delivers the message in FIFO order.

Specified by:
requestReceived in interface RequestReceiver
Parameters:
msg - The request being received

createPropose

private byte[] createPropose(Consensus cons)
Creates a value to be proposed to the acceptors. Invoked if this replica is the leader

Returns:
A value to be proposed to the acceptors

run

public void run()
This is the main code for this thread. It basically waits until this replica becomes the leader, and when so, proposes a value to the other acceptors

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread

decided

public void decided(Consensus cons)
Called by the current consensus's execution, to notify the TOM layer that a value was decided

Parameters:
cons - The decided consensus

Invoked when a timeout for a TOM message is triggered.

sendNewLeaderMessage

public void sendNewLeaderMessage(int reqId,
                                 RTLeaderChange rtLC)
Sends a RT-LEADER message to other processes. It also updates the leader

Parameters:
reqId - ID of the message which triggered the timeout
timeout - Timeout number
rtLC - Proofs for the leader change

updateLeader

private void updateLeader(int reqId,
                          int start,
                          int newLeader)
Updates the leader of the PaW algorithm. This is triggered upon a timeout for a pending message.

Parameters:
reqId - ID of the message which triggered the timeout
start - Consensus where the new leader belongs
newLeader - Replica ID of the new leader
timeout - Timeout number

deliverTimeoutRequest

public void deliverTimeoutRequest(RTMessage msg)
This method is invoked when the comunication system needs to deliver a message related to timeouts for a pending TOM message

Parameters:
msg - The timeout related message being delivered

getTimeoutInfo

public RTInfo getTimeoutInfo(int reqId)
Retrieves the timeout information for a given timeout. If the timeout info does not exist, we create one.

Parameters:
reqId - ID of the message which triggered the timeout
Returns:
The timeout information

removeTimeoutInfo

private void removeTimeoutInfo(int reqId)
Removes the timeout information for a given timeout.

Parameters:
reqId - ID of the message which triggered the timeout

timeout

public void timeout(int acceptor,
                    TOMMessage request,
                    RTInfo rti)
Invoked by the TOM layer to notify that a timeout ocurred in a replica, and to compute the necessary tasks

Parameters:
a - Replica ID where this timeout occurred
request - the request that provoked the timeout
rti - the timeout info for this request

collect

public void collect(java.security.SignedObject c,
                    int a,
                    RTInfo rti)
Invoked by the TOM layer when a collect message is received, and to compute the necessary tasks

Parameters:
c - Proof from the replica that sent the message
a - ID of the replica which sent the message

                             java.security.SignedObject[] proof)
Gets an array of valid RTCollect proofs

Parameters:
reqId - ID of the message which triggered the timeout
timeout - Timeout number
proof - Array of signed objects containing the proofs to be verified
Returns:
The sub-set of proofs that are valid
